transcripts.text: This is Chris Cuomo, the presenter of Cuomo Primetime on CNN.  On Thursday, July 2nd, Cuomo spoke with CNN political analyst Harry Enten about some recent polls and how they spell trouble for President Trump.
A Monmouth poll has Biden at 12.  A New Pew poll, similar Biden at 10.  Why do you believe these numbers at this point in time?
I mean, look, we have a lot of them.  So that indicates that these polls are well, all these results are well outside the margin area.

Enten is referring to the many, many polls that indicate that President Trump is trailing behind Joe Biden.  Are these polls an accurate reflection of how voters feel about their choice in November?  Who knows?  For now, though, let's focus on the polls that Harry Enten is talking about in this segment.  First, there was the Pew Research poll that was conducted from June 16th to the 22nd, where they asked registered voters who would handle certain issues better.  Who would make good decisions about economic policy?  Trump edged out Biden by 3 percentage points.  But when it came to handling law enforcement and criminal justice issues, Biden scored three points higher than Trump.  Which is odd considering that the 1994 crime bill, which Democrats hate and would love to see repealed, was written by then-Senator Joe Biden.  Democrats blamed the bill for the rise of harsher criminal justice policies, including the three strikes law, which contributed to so-called mass incarceration.
